channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Previously report pothole become a pothole again, 22nd February
item.description:
Hi I previously reported this about 8 weeks ago - it was filled but its crumbled and cars and bikes are once again knocking into it - it is near the bollards on the Caernavan Road x hope you didnt pay to much the first time around to a contractor x Sorry to have to report it again x

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Broad Oak Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very deep pothole, 22nd February
item.description:
Pothole extremely deep and sharp, on school side of road, just between colesbourne rd and st marks school. could easily cause damage to cars and injury to cyclists.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 62 Robert Burns Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bridge joints, 22nd February
item.description:
Bridge joints installed incorrectly, uneven joints. Water sat on top of tarmac indicates drainage not installed in joints.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Brockworth Bypass, Hucclecote

item.title: Alley choc full of black bin bags, 22nd February
item.description:
Alley way connecting New Street & the Lower High Street, between 9 New Street and rear of Oriental Stores completely blocked with black bags

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 23 New Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Advertising board attached to public notice board, 22nd February
item.description:
A paving/driveways company have attached a plastic advertising board to the public notice board at the corner of Robert Burns Ave and Bibury Rd using a cable tie.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 8 Bibury Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Banging manhole cover, 22nd February
item.description:
The manhole cover on the northbound carriage way is banging loudly when traversed by traffic. This is a noise nuisance to nearby properties and could damage the foundations of the manhole due to continual impact waves leading to road failure.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A435, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very poor condition, 22nd February
item.description:
Collapsed Virgin cable man hole cover outside no 2 Sandycroft Road, numerous pot holes on both sides of the pavement. The pavements need to be resurfaced, they have not been attended to for years. This is a high pedestrian traffic area, including prams pushchairs wheelchairs and older people. People are having to walk on the road as the pavements are so uneven and dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Sandycroft Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No T junction sign for this no through road, 22nd February
item.description:
At the top of Sandycroft Road main road end there is a 20mph speed limit sign but we need a no through road sign. Many vehicles try coming through the road not realising itâ€™s blocked off, they are trying to cut through to the other side of Sandycroft Road. Many delivery drivers are making this mistake. A no through road or T Junction sign would help avoid this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Plots 5 And 6 Sandycroft Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
